# Schnore

The server simulates the **Schnorr Identification Scheme for Non-Interactive Zero-Knowledge Proofs**, where we need to prove the knowledge of $a$. 

In order to prove that we know a secret we need to compute the value $z = a + c*x\ mod\ p$, where $A = g^a\ mod\ p$ , $X = g^x\ mod\ p$  and  $c = H(g|p|A)$ (Fiat-Shamir transformation). So the verifier just checks that  $g^z\equiv AX^c\ mod\ p$ .

To solve this challenge we need to craft a value X that verifies the condition above. Searching in google i found out [https://eprint.iacr.org/2023/691.pdf](https://eprint.iacr.org/2023/691.pdf) that crafts  $X=(g^z/A)^{1/c}$ to prove knowledge without knowing the real value of $a$.  But to calculate $1/c = c^{-1}\ mod\ p$ , `c` must be co-prime with $p-1$, which is not the case. Since the  $gcd(p-1,c)=2$  â†’ $c*(c/2)^{-1} \equiv 2\ mod\ p$ , to cancel $A$  we need to calculate $X=( (g^z)^{1/2}/ A^{1/2} )^{c^{-1}}$ .

### Solve Script

```python
from Crypto.Util import number
from Crypto.Hash import SHA512
from pwn import remote
from sage.all import GF
import random

p = 
q = 25652174680121164880516494520695513229510497175386947962678706338003
g = 
A = 

server = remote("gold.b01le.rs", 5005)
h = SHA512.new(truncate="256")
h.update(number.long_to_bytes(g) + number.long_to_bytes(p) + number.long_to_bytes(A))
c = number.bytes_to_long(h.digest()) % p

c_2 = c //2
c_2_inv = pow(c_2,-1,p-1)
print((c_2_inv*c) % (p-1))
F = GF(p)
invA = pow(A,-1,p)
invc = c_2_inv
z= random.randint(0, p-1)
gz = pow(g,z,p)

sqrt_gz = F(gz).sqrt()
sqrt_invA = F(invA).sqrt()

num=(sqrt_gz * sqrt_invA) % p
X=pow(num,invc,p)
print (f"z={z}, A={A}")
print (f"X={X}")

server.recvuntil(b"a + cx = ")
server.sendline(str(z).encode())
server.recvuntil(b"> X = ")
server.sendline(str(X).encode())
server.interactive()
```
